title.native: お兄ちゃんだけど愛さえあれば関係ないよねっ
title.romaji: Onii-chan Dakedo Ai Sae Areba Kankeinai yo ne!

description:
Akiko is thrilled to be reuniting with Akito, the handsome older brother she hasn’t seen in years! In fact, she might be a little too excited. This pint-sized cutie has a big brother complex, and she’s not interested in sharing his attention. Unfortunately for little sister, she and Akito won’t be living alone: three gorgeous girls from the student council will be along for the ride!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

__Height:__ 158cm
__Nickname:__ Minorin (みのりん)

[Official Website](https://www.minorichihara.com/) | [Profile (HoriPro)](http://www.horipro-international.com/artist/chihara) | [Website (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/chiharaminori/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/minori_parade/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minori_contact) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minori_chihara/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minori_Chihara) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/茅原実里)

Minori Chihara is a Japanese voice actress and singer.

On April 2, 2021, she announced via her blog that she was taking an indefinite hiatus on her singing activities at the end of the year, but continuing to voice act.

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Website](https://erikitamura.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KITAxERI) | [King Records](http://king-cr.jp/artist/kitaeri/)

A Japanese voice actress and singer. She used to be a child actress by the name of Eri Okamura. 

She is primarily known for her role in Blood+ as Saya Otonashi and singing "Tsuyogari," the third ending for the anime series Konjiki No Gash Bell!! She is also known to be an amateur manga artist in Japan in her spare time. Kitamura is affiliated with talent agency Early Wing and was formerly affiliated with Kaleidoscope.

Currently works in the music unit ARTERY VEIN with Asami Imai. Also provides the voice of CUL, a Vocaloid. 

__Non-Anime Roles:__

[Official Website](http://5pb.jp/shimodaasami/) | [Profile ](https://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/813/) | [Blog](https://asaponmax.fc2.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shimoda_asami)

Asami Shimoda is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer. She released her first mini album in 2010. Two years later, she released "Awake", her debut maxi single, which was released under 5pb. records. She is affiliated with Arts Vision.

Shimoda's voice samples were used to create Kagamine Rin and Len from Crypton Future Media's Character Vocal Series.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

Best known as the creator of [Project A-Ko](https://anilist.co/anime/212/). He is particularly noted for his work during the ‘80s, going all out in [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/) and many OVAs and films such as [Outlanders](https://anilist.co/anime/1940/) and [Dirty Pair](https://anilist.co/anime/1796/). He is among the many [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-influenced animators of the ‘80s, and his work is recognizable from its wide-eyed characters, attention to anatomical detail, and characterful impact frames.

Initially he wanted to be a mangaka, but enrolled in university instead after not being sure if he could make a living - though, he did drop out after a year. During his short lived time there, he was watching [Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) and had sent a letter to [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/) with the hopes of joining [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/). They weren’t accepting in-betweeners at this time, so a producer of theirs referred him to [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), which he then joined after passing an entrance test in 1979. There he studied under the studio’s founder, [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/), and started gaining attention for his work on Urusei Yatsura.

After working at [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) for a while, he took part in the establishment of Studio Graviton alongside [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/), [Shouichi Masuo](https://anilist.co/staff/133909/) and [Kouji Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/101166/). He then went freelance and worked regularly for [Studio Fantasia](https://anilist.co/studio/24/).

Lately he has shifted more and more towards directing and storyboarding rather than animating himself, often collaborating with his long-time friends [Yuuji Moriyama](https://anilist.co/staff/100658/) and [Noriyasu Yamauchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112903/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4685307000)

Originating from Studio Giants, currently freelance.

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.
